Message.Issue:
'FileHelpersImportManager<B>.FileHelpersImportManager()' contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences:
FileHelpersImportManager<B>..ctor() FileHelpersImportManager<B>.set_ShowDelimiterOption(Boolean):Void

'FileHelpersImportManager<B>.FileHelpersImportManager()' contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences:
FileHelpersImportManager<B>..ctor() FileHelpersImportManager<B>.set_ShowHeaderOption(Boolean):Void

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.SqlCommand(string, SqlConnection)' in 'ForeignKey.Update(SqlConnection, SqlTransaction)' could contain the following variables 'this.FromTable', 'this.Name'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.SqlCommand(string, SqlConnection)' in 'ForeignKey.Update(SqlConnection, SqlTransaction)' could contain the following variables 'this.FromTable', 'this.Name', 'this.FromColumn', 'this.ToTable', 'this.ToColumn', 'this.UpdateRule', 'this.DeleteRule'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
Add [Serializable] to 'ImportFormatException' as this type implements ISerializable.
Modify 'ImportManager.Dispose()' so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.
Ensure that 'ImportManager.Dispose()' is declared as public and sealed.

Implement IDisposable on 'HangfireJobEngine' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'BackgroundJobServer'. If 'HangfireJobEngine' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
'Log4NetLogger.WriteInternal(LogLevel, object, Exception)' locks on a reference of type 'Type'. Replace this with a lock against an object with strong-identity.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on 'LuceneIndexUpdateContext' or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.
Modify 'LuceneIndexUpdateContext.Dispose()' so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Implement IDisposable on 'LuceneSearchEngine' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'IndexSearcher'. If 'LuceneSearchEngine' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 68

Rule.Name: Do not call overridable methods in constructors
Rule.Description: Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called).
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences: {1}

Rule.Name: Do not lock on objects with weak identity
Rule.Description: Don't take locks on objects that may bleed across AppDomains or that don't have a strong identity.
Rule.Resolution: {0} locks on a reference of type {1}. Replace this with a lock against an object with strong-identity.

Rule.Name: Do not raise exceptions in unexpected locations
Rule.Description: Do not explicitly raise exceptions from unexpected locations. There are some methods, such as Equals and GetHashCode, which users do not expect to raise exceptions. Therefore calls to these methods are not commonly wrapped in try catch blocks.
Rule.Resolution: {0} creates an exception of type {1}, an exception type that should not be raised in a property. If this exception instance might be raised, use a different exception type, convert this property into a method, or change this property's logic so that it no longer raises an exception.

Rule.Name: Implement IDisposable correctly
Rule.Description: All IDisposable types should implement the Dispose pattern correctly.
Rule.Resolution: Modify {0} so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.
Ensure that {0} is declared as public and sealed.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on {0} or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.

Rule.Name: Interface methods should be callable by child types
Rule.Description: Explicit method implementations are defined with private accessibility. Classes that derive from classes with explicit method implementations and choose to re-declare them on the class will not be able to call into the base class implementation unless the base class has provided an alternate method with appropriate accessibility. When overriding a base class method that has been hidden by explicit interface implementation, in order to call into the base class implementation, a derived class must cast the base pointer to the relevant interface. When calling through this reference, however, the derived class implementation will actually be invoked, resulting in recursion and an eventual stack overflow.
Rule.Resolution: Make {0} sealed (a breaking change if this class has previously shipped), implement the method non-explicitly, or implement a new method that exposes the functionality of {1} and is visible to derived classes.

Rule.Name: Mark ISerializable types with SerializableAttribute
Rule.Description: The System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface allows the type to customize its serialization, while the Serializable attribute enables the runtime to recognize the type as being serializable.
Rule.Resolution: Add [Serializable] to {0} as this type implements ISerializable.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
